Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: band of dots below rim; below, painted decoration consisting of two confronted sphinxes (heads in outline remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Although Lemos does not specifically place the sherd in the Group of Antithetical Sphinxes, the subject matter is consistent with the vessels found in that grouping. Sherds in this group are both stylistically and chronologically early.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 81)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 292, no. 910, pl. 121)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1170) (phase 2)
